<!---EDITING NOTE:When editing this article, PLEASE WATCH WP:No original research-->
In 1983, [[Microsoft]] announced the development of [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], a [[graphical user interface]] (GUI) for its own [[operating system]] ([[MS-DOS]]), which had shipped for [[IBM PC]] and compatible computers since 1981. The product line has changed from a GUI product to a modern [[operating system]] over two families of design, each with its own [[codebase]] and default file system.
In 1983, [[Microsoft]] announced the development of [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], a [[graphical user interface]] (GUI) for its own [[operating system]] ([[MS-DOS]]), which had shipped for [[IBM PC]] and compatible computers since 1981. The product line has changed from a GUI product to a modern [[operating system]] over two families of design, each with its own [[codebase]] and default file system.
